crypto.name: Files In The Web
crypto.desc: A tornado ran through some of our information and scrambled up an important message with a bunch of junk. Luckily, we were able to track what the tornado did. Can you find the message?

crypto.name: Kraken
crypto.desc: The uncrackable Kraken guard hides its user's secrets. Can you uncover the secret messages?

crypto.name: My First Encryption
crypto.desc: I just learned about xor! Apparently it's super strong, surely it can protect my secret file!

crypto.name: Simpler Cipher
crypto.desc: I decided to challenge myself and build my own cryptographic cipher, surely it's unbreakable!

crypto.name: Transmission
crypto.desc:
We have intercepted two encrypted transmissions from the Automaton faction. These robotic adversaries have proven themselves persistent, calculating, and—most alarmingly—quite chatty. High Command has designated these messages as priority intelligence assets.

Intel has shown us that the Bots currently do not have enough processing power to apply robust encryption methods. As such, they have been known to reuse keys in order to allocate more computing resources to the frontline.

Message 1: 0300005f24550306010d54180b53463e05004c4c3c0d53084237024106002007455a20074b

Message 2: 003d2679070e230619092b3c1a16483b3624094c201d2c04432538281b013a3732442d1909

FYI: A related illegal broadcast from the Bot front was recorded last week, stating: "Heart. Steel. We. Kill. Iron. Will. Onto War!"

We trust you will use this information to your advantage.

For Managed Democracy and Freedom, Grand Marshal H.

crypto.name: XOR Dinary
crypto.desc: Howdy partner, I've got this hex encoded string that was XOR'ed against a single character. Think you can decrypt it for me?

forensic.name: Bunker
forensic.desc:
[REPORT] Mail notification received from access point. Subject: YoRHa_CLASSIFIED_12u3440029491.

Origin: Bunker.

Query: What is the nature of this transmission?

Hypothesis: Perhaps a deeper analysis of the files enclosed can yield more information.

Proposal: Scanner-type unit is advised to perform standard scanning procedures on the data for further analysis and conclusion.

Warning: Data appears to be classified. Any acts related to hacking and unauthorized transactions could be associated with treason. Unit is advised to perform such acts in secrecy.

forensic.name: Mystery Presentation
forensic.desc: We recently got this absolutely non-sensical presentation from a confidential informant, along with a notes that said "The truth hurts boomers, but it's what on the inside that counts <3". We can't make heads or tails of it, but it has to be important! Can you help us out?

forensic.name: Packet Detective
forensic.desc: You are security analyst given a pcap file containing network traffic. Hidden among these packets is a secret flag transmitted. Your task is to analyze the pcap file, filter out common traffic, and pinpoint the packet carrying the hidden flag.

forensic.name: Security Rocks
forensic.desc: I shared a super secret message, I hope its secure.

misc.name: Blog Hunting
misc.desc: We recently stole this zip off a someone's computer, but can't get into it. All we know about them is they have a blog, can you help us?

misc.name: Haunted Game
misc.desc: My friend just started working on his first game, but he recently disappeared and now his game prototype appears to be haunted by ghosts! I think they're trying to communicate something, but I can't figure out what it is - do you think you could help?

misc.name: So Many States
misc.desc: What does it all mean? (Surround the answer with TUCTF{} )

rev.name: Custom Image Generator
rev.desc: It's still a work in progress, but I made my own file format! It is pretty efficient I think, but there may be improvements.

rev.name: EEFFOC
rev.desc: Did you know that coffee spelt backwards is eeffoc? That's because I don't give e-foc until you've solved this challenge!

rev.name: Mystery Box
rev.desc: Lets play a game!!! You spend hours trying to guess my secret phrase! Can you figure out the secret code and retrieve the flag?

rev.name: Simple Login
rev.desc: Muhahaha, you will never get past my secret defenses. (When done correctly, this challenge returns the flag missing the opening curly brace; this needs to be there for the flag to work, and can be added easily).

web.name: Shopping Time
web.desc: I finally got my online shop up and running, check it out and see what you like!
